intro: Gomphia dependens, commonly known as the hanging gomphia, is a unique member of the Ericaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescence. It is a shrub-like plant that thrives in acidic, well-drained soils, typically in temperate to subarctic regions. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to conserve moisture in its often harsh environment. Gomphia dependens plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
